simpledes: Post-tax national income is the sum of primary incomes over all sectors (private and public), minus taxes.
technicaldes: [Post-tax national income]=[Post-tax disposable income]+[Public spending]
longtype: Ratio of Top 10% average income to Bottom 50% average income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/government-redistribution-and-development-global-estimates-of-tax-and-transfer-progressivity-1980-2019-wid-world-working-paper-2023-17/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Fisher-Post, Matthew and Gethin, Amory (2023), "Government Redistribution and Development, Global Estimates of Tax-and-Transfer Progressivity, 1980-2019" [/URL_TEXT][/URL]
method: 2019-2021 series are estimated by applying the 2018 ratio of pretax to posttax income by generalized percentile.

simpledes: Net personal wealth is  the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities, etc.) held by households, minus their debts. . The personal or household sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all households and private individuals (including those living in institutions), as well as unincorporated enterprises whose accounts are not separated from those of the households who own them.
technicaldes: [Net personal wealth]=[Personal non-financial assets]+[Personal financial assets]-[Personal debt]
longtype: Ratio of Top 10% average income to Bottom 50% average income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/global-wealth-inequality-on-wid-world-estimates-and-imputations-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-16/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Bajard, F., Chancel, L., Moshrif, R., Piketty, T. (2021). “Global Wealth Inequality on WID.world: Estimates and Imputations”[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

simpledes: Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income.
technicaldes: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
longtype: Ratio of Top 10% average income to Bottom 50% average income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-for-taiwan-1981-2017-world-inequality-lab-working-paper-2022-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Cyrus, C., Chien-Yu, C., Ming-Jen, L., Hsuan-Li, S. (2022). Distributional National Accounts for Taiwan, 1991-2017, World Inequality Lab Working Paper 2022/15;[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

simpledes: Post-tax national income is the sum of primary incomes over all sectors (private and public), minus taxes.
technicaldes: [Post-tax national income]=[Post-tax disposable income]+[Public spending]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/government-redistribution-and-development-global-estimates-of-tax-and-transfer-progressivity-1980-2019-wid-world-working-paper-2023-17/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Fisher-Post, Matthew and Gethin, Amory (2023), "Government Redistribution and Development, Global Estimates of Tax-and-Transfer Progressivity, 1980-2019" [/URL_TEXT][/URL]
method: 2019-2021 series are estimated by applying the 2018 ratio of pretax to posttax income by generalized percentile.

simpledes: Fiscal income is defined as the sum of all income items reported on income tax returns, before any deduction. It includes labour income, capital income and mixed income. The concept of fiscal income varies with national tax legislations, so in order to make international comparisons it is preferable to use the concept of national income.
technicaldes: [Fiscal income ]=[Fiscal labour income [total fiscal income ranking]]+[Fiscal capital income [total fiscal income ranking]]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/wid_working_paper_2015_6_taiwan/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chu, Cyrus; Chow, Teyu, and Hu, Sheng-Cheng (2015). Top Income Shares in Taiwan 1977-2013. WTID Working Paper 2015/2.; [/URL_TEXT][/URL]
method: Married males plus divorced or widowed single individuals, plus unmarried males and females aged 20 or older. Excludes capital gains.

simpledes: Net personal wealth is  the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities, etc.) held by households, minus their debts. . The personal or household sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all households and private individuals (including those living in institutions), as well as unincorporated enterprises whose accounts are not separated from those of the households who own them.
technicaldes: [Net personal wealth]=[Personal non-financial assets]+[Personal financial assets]-[Personal debt]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.

shortname: Pre-tax labor income [pre-tax labor income ranking]
simpledes: Pre-tax labor income [pre-tax labor income ranking] is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the individual owners of labor as a production factor, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income.
technicaldes: Pre-tax labor income [pre-tax labor income ranking]=Compensation of employees [pre-tax labor income ranking]+Labor component of net mixed income [pre-tax labor income ranking]+Pensions and social insurance income (labor share) [pre-tax labor income ranking]
longtype: Income or wealth shares. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pX', the raw data stores the share of total income or wealth detained by all the population between threshold pX and the top of the distribution. When the associated percentile is of the form 'pXpY', the raw data stores the share of the population between thresholds pX and pY.
longpop: The population looked at is comprised of female individuals only.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals over age 20.
source: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/half-the-sky-the-female-labor-income-share-in-a-global-perspective-world-inequality-lab-working-paper-2021-22/ [/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Neef, T., Robilliard, A.-S. (2021), “Half the sky? The Female Labor Income Share in a Global Perspective”[/URL_TEXT][/URL]
method: The age of the adult population is 15 years and older

simpledes: Corporate bonds & loans are bonds and loans owned by the corporate sector (companies). The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).

simpledes: Corporate financial assets excluding cash are financial assets except cash and bank deposits owned by the corporate sector (companies). The corporate sector - in the national accounts sense - includes all financial and non-financial corporations with an economic activity in a given country, whatever their legal status (with the exceptions of unincorporated enterprises included in the personal sector).

longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Book-value national wealth is the sum of value of assets according to the books (balance sheets) on which they are carried. It is the difference between net national wealth and national net corporate wealth. The national economy - in the national accounts sense - includes all domestic sectors, i.e. all entities that are resident of a given country (in the sense of their economic activity), whether they belong to the private sector, the corporate sector, the governement sector.
technicaldes: [Book-value national wealth]=[Market-value national wealth ]+[Residual corporate wealth]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

technicaldes: [Market-value national wealth ]=[National non-financial assets]+[Net foreign assets]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.

simpledes: Private bonds & loans are bonds and loans held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private bonds & loans]=[Personal bonds & loans]+[Non-profit bonds & loans]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

simpledes: Private pension funds & life insurance are pension funds and life insurance held by private owners (households and foundations). The private sector - in the national accounts sense - includes the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (foundations, religious organizations, etc.). In certain countries, availables sources do not allow to decompose the wealth owned by each of these two sub-sectors, and we only provide total net private wealth.
technicaldes: [Private pension funds & life insurance]=[Personal pension funds & life insurance]+[Non-profit pension funds & life insurance]
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

shortname: Net Public Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Public Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net wealth of the public sector by net national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: Public wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of government wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: Net Personal Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Personal Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net wealth of the personal sector (households) by net national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: Household wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of household wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: Net Non-Profit Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Non-Profit Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net wealth of the non-profit sector (philanthropy foundations, religious organizations, universities, etc.) by net national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: Nonprofit wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of NPISH wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: Net national wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Wealth-Income Ratio is the division of national wealth by national income.
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: National wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of market-price national wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: Net Private Wealth to Net National Income Ratio
simpledes: Net Private Wealth to Net National Income Ratio is the division of net private wealth by net national income. Private wealth consists of net wealth of the personal sector (households) and the non-profit sector (philanthropy foundations, religious organizations, universities, etc.).
longtype: Ratio of net wealth (of a given sector) to net national income
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.
source: WID.world estimates based on macro aggregates: see method and corresponding macro variables for details.
method: Private wealth-to-income ratio defined as the ratio of household and NPISH wealth to market-price national income. See [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/distributional-national-accounts-guidelines-2020-concepts-and-methods-used-in-the-world-inequality-database/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]DINA Guidelines[/URL_TEXT][/URL] for details.

shortname: PPP conversion factor, LCU per EUR
simpledes: PPP conversion factor of current local currency to current PPP EUR.
longtype: Exchange rate series
longpop: The base unit is the individual (rather than the household). This is equivalent to assuming no sharing of resources within couples.
longage: The population is comprised of individuals of all ages.

method: We extrapolate the PPP from its 2017 value using the evolution of the price index relative to the reference country.
